question_text: A 68-year-old patient presents with a papule on the right cheek, as shown, that has been present for 4 months, is growing larger in size, and bleeds spontaneously.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This patient has a nodular basal cell carcinoma (Option B). The most common type of basal cell carcinoma, nodular basal cell carcinoma appears as a glossy pink to ivory papule or plaque, often featuring a rolled, distinct border and prominent bizarre telangiectases. Over time a central erosion or ulceration may develop. Occasionally, blue-grey flecks of pigmentation may be observed, but these are quite distinct from the broad, dark pigmentation of melanocytic lesions such as malignant melanoma.
